context: The Estonian word 'ilm' has multiple meanings depending on context. Most commonly it means 'weather', as in atmospheric conditions. It can also be used poetically to mean 'world'. Additionally, in colloquial usage, 'ilm' can function as an adverb meaning 'indeed', 'certainly', or 'very much' - similar to the English expressions 'by all means' or 'of course'. The word's form changes according to case and number in Estonian grammar.
